reviews.review: Izgalmas történet, szórakoztató coop. Igazi klasszikus, nagyon ajánlom!

DAMN this game is good. I think at this point everyone knows what the Portal series is, so I'll just point out some of the highlights.
The story is great with interesting characters and a perfect pace. The plot twists are well done and it only tells you what you need to know. The story is also supplemented by the great humor.
Of course it's a puzzle game, so the puzzles and level design need to be good. Luckily, they're done flawlessly. On top of that the environments are also amazing and add lots to the world.
Once you're done with the story mode there's a level creator that is perfectly made and allows you to do just about anything you want. People have used this to make some crazy and amazing levels. The community, while I'm not sure how active it is now, has always been very helpful and creative. You'll never run out of content as long as talented map creators exist.
Definitely a must play for anyone. It's only $20 and worth every penny.
ㅇ

Nice

Pekala itiraf ediyorum! İlk Portal oyunuyla tanışmama bir hayli geç oldu. Neden bilmiyorum ancak ilk çıktığı zamanlarda zamanın yeni çıkan oyunları arasında biraz kaynamıştı. Dolayısı ile tam olarak ilgi gösteremedim ancak en sonunda onunla tanışınca kalbimi bu kadar çabuk fethedeceğini hiç ummuyordum.

Oldum olası bilmece, bulmaca olaylarına ilgi duymuşumdur eskiden beri. Ne zaman zeka oyunları veya zeka sorularıyla ilgili bir kitap bulsam, filmle karşılaşsam onu sömürürdüm. Onları çözme konusunda çok çok iyi olduğumu söyleyemem ancak yine de boş değilimdir hani.

İşte böyle bir anda Portal gibi bir oyunu oynamak benim için ne kadar tatmin edici olduğunu hayal edebilirsiniz. İlk açtığımda ne yapacağımı bilemediğim Aperture Science’ın o beyaz duvarları arasında koşuşturmak, GLaDOS’un huşu dolu sesiyle rahatlamak ve turretlerın “I don’t hate you” sözleri ile hala sevildiğimi bilme duygusunu yaşamak oyun boyunca kahkahalarla geçen bu zaman içerisinde ayrı bir motivasyon olmuştu benim için.

Şimdi üzerinden dört yıl geçti ve bu mükemmel oyunun ikincisi raflara çıktı. Ne yalan söyleyeyim hayatımda ilk defa gözümü bile kırpmadan parayı basıp aldığım bir oyundur Portal 2. Hatta ilk defa ön sipariş ile aldığım oyun olduğunu da yine itiraf ediyorum. Neyse benden bu kadar bahsetmek yeter. Şimdi gelelim Chell, GLaDOS, Atlas, P-Body ve elbette ki yeni dostumuz Wheatley’e.

It’s allright, it’s allright don’t be panic! Ok, you may panic! 

Valve’ın aslında pek çok oyuncuda büyük bir hayal kırıklığına uğrattığına hepimiz hem fikirizdir büyük olasılıkla. Nitekim Valve’ın Valve olmasını sağlayan, oyun dünyasına 40 milyon tonluk ağır bir top gibi düşen Half-Life’ın Episode 3’ünü yıllar geçmesine rağmen çıkartmaması pek çok kişiyi hayal kırklığına uğrattı. Ancak Valve bu işte bir yerden alırken bir yerden veriyor.

İlk başta dilerseniz Portal 2’nin konusundan başlayalım. İlk oyunu bitirenlerin hatırlayacağı gibi Chell ile sevimli ve esprili yapay zekamız GLaDOS’u yok edip kendimizi Aperture Science’ın dışında baygın (her ne kadar etrafı görebilsek de Chell’in o sırada baygın olduğunu düşünüyorum) bir şekilde yatarken buluyorduk. Ardından göremediğimiz ancak robotik sesler çıkartan bir şey tarafından sürüklenirken oyunumuz sona eriyordu.
well written game

Шедевральное продолжение первой части Portal.В этой части по моему мнению более интересен сюжет и разнообразие в тестовых камерах. Если в первой части были только порталы и энергошары, то тут чего ток нет и воронки, в которых можно летать и мосты из солнечного света и лазеры и многое другое. В этой игре мы познаем правило ''Враг моего врага-мой друг'', где в начале игры нам помогает маленький робот Уитли, а бывший враг хочет нас всю жизнь пытать в камерах испытаний, а потом все меняется и Гладос становится другом а Уитли становится  врагом. Игра понравилась, прошел с удовольствием, порадовал также и coop режим. 8.5 /10
当年高考结束后玩到的第一款游戏，怀念一下自己的青春，谢谢Valve。
Kinda fun until you get to a puzzle that you't solve just to figure out it was in front of your face the whole time.The coop is also really really fun

El videojuego es extremadamente recomendable si te llama la atencion los puzzles, la historia es exelente y tiene un trasfondo bastante considerable, la jugablidad es un punto muy importante, ya que es muy basica y facil entender, y si en algun momento del juego se introduce una nueva mecanica, se explica muy bien como hacer uso de ella para poder avanzar .
Aparte de todo esto, tenemos el modo cooperativo que es exelente y su dificultad es mucho mayor y es un buen reto para afrontar con algun amigo.
¿Y si ya me termine la campaña y el modo cooperativo? 
No te preocupes, ya que la comunidad constantemente crea mapas para que otros jugadores los puedan probar, puedes crear tus propios mapas y publicarlos para que la gente lo pruebe y califique, y asi mismo puedes jugar mapas de los demas y dar tu opinion sobre ellos.
En resumen, un juego exelente al que le puedes sacar muchas horas de diversion, 100% recomendable.

The best game ever! 10 из 10. Всё круто: сюжет, графика (для 2011-2012 года вообще отпад), футуристичность, персонажи, геймплей, локации... Отдельно хотелось бы отметить саундтрек. Он отличный. Последние две песенки скачал себе :) Немного был опечален лишь своей тупостью, что начал не с первого Портальчика... Но игра так построена, что даже не проходя Portal 1, ты сможешь легко вникнуть в сюжет.  Лучшая игра, в которую я играл на ПК. 10 из 10.

Portal 2 is a first-person puzzle game developed by Valve Software and released in 2011.
let's start this review by saying that I like this game A LOT.
I like it so much, in fact, that is in my top 5 favourite games of all times.


[h1] GAMEPLAY: [/h1]  In Portal, you solve puzzles with the help of a very special and iconic tool: the portal gun! wich allows you to shoot portals (captain obvious) and teleporting (captain obvious #2) anything that passes through them instantly, this is not only a very creative way to create puzzle games, but also allows to solve puzzles in potentially countless ways.

The learning curve is just right, teaching the player how each mechanic works without (almost) any text or verbal output. 
The player is always capable of guessing how a mechanic works with experimentation, starting with a very simple and short puzzle, and adding more and more complexity as you progress.


[h1] STORY: [/h1]  Not only Portal is set in a quite unique environment, and, thanks to the sound design, has a very nice atmosphere, but it's also one of the very few games that I qualify as "comedic".
Every single line of dialogue by GLaDOS or Wheatley is simply a gem, and these characters are one of the main reasons why so many people love this game, each of these character's voice performances is terrific, along with the great writing and character design, you have two of the most admired characters in the gaming industry.


[h1] GRAPHICS: [/h1]
it's clear how much detail the developers have put into creating the world of Portal, as the textures always have very high resolution and the ambience has its distinct style. Also, as repetitive as the Aperture Science's laboratory may be, the developers made the setting look different over time, changing location drastically to keep the player in a fresh environment.

The game, as expected on Source Engine, ran smoothly through all the 76 hours of playtime I had, and never suffered from a framerate drop.


[h1] CONCLUSION: [/h1]
What else can I say? The music is great, it fits perfectly with the sci-fi atmosphere of the game, the sound effects have a really high quality, and if all that wasn't enough, BOOM! 6 extra hours to spend with a friend in co-op puzzles! But wait...that still isn't enough...what about a test chamber editor connected to the steam workshop, so you can play an infinite amount of puzzles for the rest of your life or create your own to share with the world?

This game doesn't have many downsides, the only problem I had is that I didn't quite like some rare sections of the story set in gigantic, asymmetric spaces, finding it confusing most of the time to get through. The only other problem that you might have with this game is your taste, of course. A must-buy if you like puzzle games.

After rating all the aspects of the game, I've come to the conclusion that there is no reason for me to not give this game a 10/10. No game is perfect, but this one comes really close to such achievement.

Portal 2 is like Portal 1, but a lot more portally!  Oh, that's rediculous, but it's totally true.  All of the things that made Portal 1 great:  the atmosphere, the puzzles, the story and character development (except of the main character, of whom we know nothing, but that's ok.)...all of those things are here in Portal 2 but much more so.  It's a great ride, and the puzzles are good...really good...after playing this game for a few hours, you're brain will actually be a little tired...So, it's probably good for you and will, like, stave off demensia, or something....too late for me, though:(  But, anyways!  If you liked Portal 1, you have to play this follow on, and if you haven't played Portal 1, then you should play it.  Also, the plot, mood, immersion, theme, etc, are incredible.  I literally laughed and cried (only a little!), while playing that game (and only some of those tears would due to temporary frustration at solving a thing).  The plot is amazing.  Now, granted, this is portal...don't expect a ton of depth and meta-strategy, but there's something to be said for a game in which the point is to just keep moving forward.  It's brilliant in its simplicity and beauty, and it's another game that exhibits the truth that games can be deep, meaningful, engaging, enriching art.  Very enriching.  You'll get all the enrichment you can handle, really.  Anyways, I'll stop rambling like on the main characters does and wrap this up!  This is a super well-crafted game and highly recommended.
Must play, after portal 1, of course.
